definition: 7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)

sentences.english: The sun that shone on the British empire had passed midday.
sentences.chinese: 照耀大英帝國的太陽已過晌午。

sentences.english: Where do you make it lie down at noon?
sentences.chinese: 晌午在何處使羊羣歇臥？

sentences.english: The sun's rays only reach here at high-noon.
sentences.chinese: 正晌午陽光才能照進來。

sentences.english: It was already late afternoon when he exchanged his animals several times.
sentences.chinese: 時間早已過了晌午，動物也交換了好幾次。

sentences.english: Where dost thou make thy flock to rest at noon?
sentences.chinese: 禰的羊晌午在何處歇臥？

definition: 11 am-1 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
to hold a lamp/to light a lamp
in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
time/period during the day/one of the 12 two-hour periods enumerated by the earthly branches 地支
3-5 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
5-7 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
1-3 pm (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
color of the sky/time of day, as indicated by the color of the sky/weather
(dialect) to begin to dawn/to be just getting light
